CatDescriptText: Miss Kitty Allen, business training college student, 2 Pine Street, Carnegie, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 24, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that President Eisenhower should invoke the Taft-Hartley Act in steel strike?" answer reads: "Yes. It would enable both management and labor to make up their minds.  It's about time that he did this, because the steel strike is affecting the whole economy."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Kitty Allen wearing striped sweater and striped coat with dark collar, holding zippered binder, and standing in front of Mellon Bank, Downtown
